p: Both viruses have a high level of genetic diversity within and between hosts and a high rate of evolution. For HIV-1, several groups, subtypes and circulating recombinant forms (CRFs) are described; for HCV seven different genotypes have been described and each genotype has distinct subtypes [ 7, 8]. The high evolutionary rate allows us to study the transmission history of both viruses by analysing their genomic sequences with phylogenetic methods.
